name: Cyanocephalus_glocimarii
locality: São Salvador do Tocantins: Estrada de acesso ao Córrego Mutum, Fazenda São Jorge, 350 m
remarks: doi:10.1007/S12225-021-09946-3 The specific epithet is dedicated to Glocimar Pereira-Silva.

name: Eriope_orlandoi
locality: Rio de Contas, ao norte da cidade, na beira da estrada antigamente chamada a Estrada de Ouro, nos arredores da Serra Molhada, 1127 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.591.1.7 Etymology: the specific epithet honours local guide, Orlando Santos, whose perspicacity at finding interesting plant species, resulted in the collection of this new species.

name: Hyptis_albolanata
remarks: doi:10.1111/njb.03973 Etymology: 'The epithet refers to the white and lanate indumentum that covers branches, leaves and inflorescence'.

name: Hyptis_apertifolia
publication: Repert. Spec. Nov. Regni Veg. Beih.
reference: Repert. Spec. Nov. Regni Veg. Beih. 85: 273. 1936

locality: Pará: Novo Progresso: Serra do Cachimbo, próximo a Base Aeronáutica, campos de provas Brigadeiro Veloso

name: Hyptis_lavoisierifolia
locality: Mun. Alto Paraíso de Goiás, Parque Nacional da Chapada dos Veadeiros, Morro vizinho ao Morro da Baleia, 1275 m
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.507.2.5 The epithet is a reference to the plant genus Lavoisiera Candolle (1828:102), the leaves of which resemble the new species.

name: Hyptis_melittiflora
remarks: doi:10.1007/S12225-021-09942-7 Etymology: the flowers of Hyptis melittiflora are much visited by honey bees, attracted to both the pollen and the abundant nectar.

locality: São Gabriel, Alto da Lagoa Nova

name: Hyptis_spathulata
remarks: doi:10.1590/2175-7860202172011 Etymology: 'The name was given in reference to the spathulate leaves shape'.

name: Oocephalus_griseus

remarks: doi:10.1600/036364422X16512564801588 Etymology: name refers to the colour of the leaves, which are greenish white, appearing whitish grey under natural light.

remarks: doi:10.1007/S12225-022-10064-X Etymology: because the new species is restricted to the Espírito Santo mountains, the name honours the Pomeranian people of Espírito Santo.
